jobDescription: Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:No Active Clearance RequiredClearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:No Active Clearance RequiredSuitability:Public TrustJob Family:Information TechnologyJob Description:We are seeking a mid to senior level Data Analytics Analyst to work on a fast-pace team responsible for monitoring and maintaining Data Quality within a very large Oracle production databases. You will find, investigate and map out strategies to correct data quality issues that impact numerous DMDC business areas that impact mostly military healthcare benefits, eligibility and entitlement. Your work will directly support service members and their families.Responsibilities: A typical day for you could involve:Respond to urgent data quality issues that ariseUse SQL and PL/SQL to investigate, resolve, monitor data quality issuesPerform proactive analysis to discover and research previously unknown problem areasHelp the team expand the team’s suite of recurring and ad-hoc error reports to assess the state of DMDC’s data qualityMonitor reports for anomalies pointing to new issues requiring examinationWork closely with the team’s analysts, management, project managers, business analysts, developers, quality assurance and database administrators to determine root causes for data quality issues and devise remediation plans that both prevent future occurrences and restore data that has already been affectedDesign and administer data collection tools, clean, merge and manage existing data sets as well as establish and maintain data quality procedures to ensure accuracy and timeliness of dataQualifications: To qualify, you must have these basic qualifications:U.S. Citizens only due to government contract requirementsMust be clearable for DMDC Position of Trust5-10 years of experienceExperience with Relational Database conceptsPL/SQL or experience with other procedural programming languageKnowledge of SQL and SQL query optimization BA/BS degreeDesired qualifications:Advanced SQL skills/experiencePrevious Department of Defense (DoD) assignmentExcellent problem solving, data quality/analytics abilityAbility to multi-task to manage differing sets of data requests and analyticsStrong verbal and written communicationProficient at using Microsoft product suite (Words, Excel, Access, OneNote, etc.)OracleKnowledgeable of or experience with data warehouseOther qualifications:Position demands active, continuous collaboration and learning about the business rules underlying DMDC’s many lines of businessSelf-driven with ability to work on many concurrent projects and deliver results on eachAbility to counsel clients about the analytic process and how to use data to answer policy and program questionsAbility to create and deliver presentations on a regular basis and developing and implementing data visualizations and dashboardsDeliver quality work with attention to details# of Openings:1Scheduled Weekly Hours:40Telecommuting
